forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 45, with temperatures rising to around 47 overnight. West southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms likely before 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 53. West northwest wind 15 to 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the depths of the night, Downtown San Francisco stands shrouded in the whispered embrace of showers and electric murmurs of thunder, a somber canopy of clouds hanging low over the city. The chill settles into the air, hinting at the subtle promise of rain. Approaching dawn will bring little respite, as the day unfolds under a predominantly gray sky, with intermittent showers continuing to aquaint the ground with its crisp, cool touch. Those venturing out should expect blustery winds, dancing lightly around the edges of a once-familiar landscape, adding an edge to daily routines.

As the sun fights through the clouds by late morning, fleeting glimpses of blue may still be hard to find. However, there lies a whispered promise of clarity in the afternoon, as the storms grow weary and make way for moments of sun—albeit held at bay by a strong breeze. Yet, one must be prepared for sudden shifts, with rain that might return unexpectedly. A layered approach to clothing—perhaps a lightweight waterproof jacket wrapped around a cozy sweater—will suffice to ward off the late-night chill and an impromptu drizzle, keeping you comfortable whether you choose to explore the local café scene or take a brisk walk along Market Street amidst the hustle of a city busily waking up.
